I didn't play Half Life growing up.
I knew how big of a deal it was to many and as a FPS lover I knew I owed it to myself to play it.
And I did recently, and I was astonished on how much of a blueprint this game is to even the latest FPS games.

That's also a sad thing as we rarely* see such leaps anymore in our industry. Everyone is so contempt with the same formula given to them in a new skin with a bare bone story.

Tangent aside, I understand why Half Life is amazing. 
From the gun play, storytelling and atmosphere, I can now truly appreciate what Half Life did for first person shooters.

Played this again on difficult.

Enjoyed having to be very strategical on this difficulty.

Der erste Teil von Half-life ist gealtert wie ein feines Glas Milch.
Die Story mag schön und gut sein, jedoch ist das Gameplay einfach nicht mehr präsentierbar. Spiele wie Until dawn oder Beyond: Two Souls sind nicht Gameplay focused. Sie sind sehr fixiert auf die Story. Der Unterschied zu Half-life ist das diese Spiele keine Sessions von Gameplay zwischen die Story passagen ballern, die mir nach fünf Minuten bereits den Appetit genommen haben. Ich sage nicht, dass man einen Haufen Gameplay Mechaniken haben muss, aber bitte ein wenig Abwechselung. Auch wenn ich es mal jetzt sage, wie ich es glaube: Abwechselung würde die langweiligen veralteten Kämpfe nicht interessanter machen. Es würde es erträglicher machen, das Spiel lange am Stück zu spielen, jedoch habe ich bereits gesagt, dass die Kämpfe mich das Spiel nach fünf Minuten schließen lassen. Insgesamt kann ich nur sagen, dass ich Half-life respektieren kann, da es einfach Iconic ist, aber leider nach heutigen Standards nicht empfehlen kann.
3/10 would not play again.

This game saved my life.

I am 41.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: :hillary: minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.
After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

Also, something kind of corny that I liked was the little small remarks the scientists have in the beginning. Gotta be honest, never heard of Half-Life until I became a PC gamer in 2012. Played Half-Life 2 about two years later after buying it to play Garry's Mod, which I loved. I knew enough of the story to get through the second game and loved it. One of the best games I've ever played. 

FINALLY got around to playing the majority of Half-Life 1 for the last couple of weeks. I've played the first 30 minutes on and off over the last 5 years. First 30 minutes is slow and boring IMO. But I pushed through. And dear god, I've been missing out. The game is not your standard FPS. You "could" go in guns blazing, but the game heavily encourages you to be at least a little smart about how you play. You get to a point where you actually enjoy reloading a save after scanning how many enemies are in a room, and blowing them up with trip mines and grenades. Then taking the rest out with your trusty shotgun. At one point I spent five minutes brain storming how to take out these soldiers in the generator room elevator in a creative way. I ended up setting a trip mine right in the middle of the elevator, pressed the button and laughed my ass off as they came down and exploded in a gory mess.

That's when I knew this game was special. The goldsrc engine isn't Source, I know. It's certainly not that impressive. But the creative gameplay mechanics makes up for it. You'll spend a lot of time in the first half playing the "where the f*ck do I go" game, but you'll get the hang of it. Don't feel bad for looking up Youtube walkthroughs though. IMO, if you spend too much time trying to figure out where to go, it gets boring and makes you want to quit. So I say go for it. 

TL;DR: This game is fucking awesome. Standard FPS players will take some time to get used to it. But it's worth it.

Replayed it after some time, and honestly it's still as good. It has some "problems" due to its age but it's super well made, although Xen is not as good as the Black Mesa facility in terms of design, I still enjoyed it. It's been over a decade since the last time I played this masterpiece of a game and it's just as I remembered it when first playing it. 

I can imagine it's pretty difficult for gamers nowadays to play (close to the original) Half-Life 1, considering that there's a source version as well as the superior Black Mesa version. That being said, there's something truly special about the vanilla version.

Having gone back after all these years, I have to say that I wasn't disappointed. The game still holds well even after all these years. It ran perfectly on my system, it easily supported 2k resolution and overall the game ran flawlessly, with only this weird echo in the game that's bothersome at first, but you get used to it eventually (never figured out how to turn it off).

Do I recommend this game? Yes, I really do, it's one of the games that enhanced story telling in games as well as improving the overall FPS genre. On that same breath, I understand that this game is pretty old now. If graphics is a bother to you, then perhaps consider playing the Black Mesa version. It's really worth getting into the game.

O verdadeiro Pai dos jogos de Tiro em Primeira Pessoa. Half-Life conta com uma Gameplay que não é nem um pouco velha, mesmo depois de quase 20 anos após seu lançamento.
Com uma história subliminar, uma AI que ainda que antiga, continua te impressionando e uma Gameplay que te faz pensar fora da caixa - Half-Life segue firmemente sua Tagline de "Pense, Atire, Corra e Viva".

Jogos em Primeira Pessoa não seriam os mesmos sem este lançamento icônico da Valve. Altamente recomendo.

I was introduced to this '98 classic via shitposts with videos of cats with the sound effects of this game. Mentions of this game were also in reviews of other boomer-shooters from the era, but nothing was clicking with me. Quake looked cool, but It was missing something. A story. I really like cinema, and I always tell my friends, "Half-Life is a game for people who want to watch a movie." So the existence of a cinematic, action-platform fps is just really neat. I was also streaming the game on Discord with a few of my friends that didn't really care for the game, but they commented on how the game seemed to age with grace. Also the multiplayer is  a nice thing to add to it. 10/10. :)

Kaç sefer başlamış olup sırf motion sickness'tan dolayı bırakmış biri olarak bitirme kısmeti bugüneymiş...

Half-life bilindiği üzere FPS türünün mihenk taşlarından ve üstünden 20 yılı aşkın süre geçmesine rağmen oynanış konusunda (her ne kadar tepkiler konusunda yetersiz olsa da) hala daha gideri olan aşırı geniş bir silah yelpazesine sahip bir oyun ve hepsinin birbirinden tamamen farklı olması hasebiyle kendine bağlamayı başarıyor.

Grafik konusunda 98 yapımı oyunu bugüne kıyaslamanın mantığı yok ama genel itibariyle tasarım olarak iyi iş başarmışlar. Özellikle o ilk yarısındaki tesis havası cidden aşırı güzeldi. Ancak ikinci yarısındaki Xen kısımları da bir o kadar berbat. Hem yol bulma olsun hem sinir bozucu platformlar olsun ilk oynayışınız ise (benim gibi) büyük ihtimal kanser olacaksınız. Tasarım demişken düşman tasarımlarının da cidden güzel olduğunu söylemekte fayda var, her ne kadar çeşitlerinin az olduğu ve arttırılabileceğini düşünsem bile.

Hikaye konusunda maalesef oyun hiçbir şey vermiyor. Etrafta bulunup okunabilecek bir şey olsa neyse ama olayları nereye gittiğinizden ve kiminle kapıştığınızdan çıkartmak zorunda kalıyorsunuz genelde maalesef. Hikayesi ile de öne çıktığı söylenen sırf yarım kaldığından son oyunu beklenen bir serinin ilk oyunun hikaye anlamında daha dolu olmasını beklerdim. Karakter konusunda da genelde sınıfta kalıyor. Özellikle konuşmamasına rağmen yedirilen Freeman karakterinin konuşmaya zaten pek ihtiyacı olmuyor zira karşısındaki karakterler şunu yap, sonra bunu yap vs. emir kalıpları ile kısa 1-2 cümle kurup karakterimizi alana tekrar geri salıyorlar.

Ses ve müzik konusunda da iyi bir iş olduğunu söylemek gerek. Özellikle bazı bölümlerdeki müzikler cidden çok güzel tek sıkıntıları kısa olmaları :d

Son olarak(uyarı mahiyetinde) oyunda bazı yerlerde karakteriniz zemine batıyor ve çıkmıyor. Bu yüzden sık sık save alın. Ve birde Veri Yürütme Engelleyicisi(DEP)'ni oyun için kapatın yoksa belli bir save aldıktan sonra oyun kendi kendine kapatıyor.

Sonuç olarak her ne kadar 20 yılı aşırmış olsa bile elinizde hala gideri olan bir oyun var. Zaten indirimlerde almayanı dövüyorlar, zamanınızı da hak edecek bir yapım var karşınızda.
AMAZING
A true masterpiece that lives on even to this day.
